title: The Apprentice's Lubna confirms Lottie race row and admits she felt 'paranoid'
text:

The Apprentice star Lubna Farhan has confirmed a race row with Lottie Lion.

Librarian Lottie, 19, has been accused of bullying Lubna, 33, on a vicious group WhatsApp chat created by candidates after filming ending.

Finance manager Lubna, whose parents are Pakistani, was told Lottie would would knock her out and even "f*** her up."

Speaking to Mirror Online after being fired by lord Sugar, Lubna admitted that Lottie has "a lot to learn in terms of how to treat people".

The mum-of-two, who revealed she is no longer part of the nasty WhatsApp group, confessed she felt "paranoid" around the other candidates.

When asked about the race row, Lubna told us: "It has already been in the media so I don't think there's much more I can add to that.

"All I can say is I wish her well, she has a lot to learn in terms of how to treat people, but she is quite young and I'm sure that within this process she has learnt a lot and will take something from it.

"I’m not going to sit here and lie and say that was wrong."

On whether the show had offered her any aftercare following the 'racist' comments, Lubna added: "It's not something that necessarily would be wise for me to talk about at this moment."

Earlier this month, a spokesperson for The Apprentice told Mirror Online: “We are currently looking into the circumstances regarding a complaint.”

Lottie added: "I categorically deny being a racist, homophobic or transphobic. I have no further comment.”

When the news broke, Lottie said: “I appreciate the messages sent between myself and Lubna could come across as offensive but they were intended as a joke and no offence was meant by them."

(Image: BBC)

Lubna also had her say on that fiery clash with Lottie in South Africa during the first task.

Giving her verdict, she told us: "I am someone who speaks when I need to speak and I did feel strongly I had to step in.

"I felt the sub team leader should have spoken up. If she had been a stronger leader and managed Lottie better I would not have to speak up.

"It's not like I’m an attention seeker and was speaking up to be in the limelight. I'd had enough of not being given an opportunity to talk when I’m already an introvert.

"I got to the point where I just had enough and I don’t think I did anything wrong."

(Image: BBC / Boundless)

Lubna admitted she was glad to leave the process as she was missing her two kids and "struggling" without her family.

On the rivalry in the house, she said: "I would say the tension is always there. I personally felt a lot of paranoia.

"You don’t have your phone and you don’t know who these people you are living and competing with are.

"You don’t know anything about them apart from their name. Even the stories they’re telling you, you don’t know if they’re making it up as it is a competition. I felt really paranoid and didn't know who to trust.

"I am an introvert so I really went into my shell, especially when people were screaming and shouting. I tried to be an observer.

"It's hard to live with people who could be working against you and trying to stitch you up."

Lubna admitted she held back because she is a qualified Chartered Accountant and was conscious of how she was going to be protrayed.

She admitted: "I think I was too nice. I could have thrown people under the bus and grovelled to Lord Sugar but I didn't do those things as I'd planned to be myself in the process.

"Me overreacting or pretending to be someone else...I wouldn’t have done justice to myself.

"I’m actually quite proud of my performance. I don’t think I let myself down and I stuck to my principles.

Lubna called out some of her fellow candidates for being fake, but admitted she understands why they were acting.

She added: "I would say the majority were [acting] but I don't think that's necessarily a bad thing as they understand they’re playing a game.

"It is a TV show and you need to stand out. You’ve got to play the game to win and do well in the process."

*The Apprentice airs Wednesdays on BBC One at 9pm
description: EXCLUSIVE: Fired candidate Lubna Farhan admitted Lottie Lion has a lot to learn on how to treat people after making 'racist' remarks
